meanings.definition: Past tense of overslip: to slip or slide past something
meanings.sent1: I overslipt the puddle on my way to school.
meanings.sent2: The cat overslipt the sleeping dog without waking it up.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky squirrel overslipt the bird feeder to steal some seeds.
meanings.sent4: Her words overslipt my defenses and touched my heart.
meanings.sent5: The ninja overslipt the guards and entered the palace unnoticed.

meanings.definition: Past participle of overslip: having slipped or slid past something
meanings.sent1: The overslipt thief escaped without leaving a trace.
meanings.sent2: The overslipt banana peel caused a hilarious fall in the comedy show.
meanings.sent3: The overslipt ice skater glided effortlessly across the rink.
meanings.sent4: Her overslipt remark went unnoticed by most of the audience.
meanings.sent5: The overslipt shadow crept along the wall, unnoticed by the unsuspecting victim.
